issues.title: SSO provider session not invalidated at Kapua session invalidation
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
When the session expires, the user is logged out from the Kapua console. However, if the user is an external one logged through SSO, he can login again by simply clicking on the 'SSO Login' button, without the need to insert again his credentials. This is due to the SSO session not yet invalidated, while the Kapua Console one already is.

One possible solution would be to simply reduce the time of the SSO session to a lower value than the Kapua Console one. Note that the Kapua Console session time is set though the `session-timeout` tag in the `web.xml` in `console/web/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF`. However, this is not the best option, since there is no synchronisation between the two session. Also, it requires to configure the SSO Provider session timeout at each installation. A better option would be to invalidate the SSO session using the SSO OpenId Connect logout endpoint when the Kapua one is invalidated.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Login to Kapua with an external SSO user (an SSO provider is required)
2. Wait 30 minutes (the Kapua session timeout), after this amount of time the user should be logged out
3. Click on the 'SSO Login' button
4. The user is logged in without the need to insert credentials.

**Expected behavior**
The SSO session should be invalidated at the same time as the Kapua one.

**Screenshots**
_N/A_

1.2.0-SNAPSHOT

issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
The Service Event scope id is the scope id of the user that triggered the event. In some case (i.e. when the admin user set/modify some entity outside his scope) this value doesn't reflect the entity scope id preventing the possibility to retrieve the original entity that triggered the event.
So adding a new field to track the entity scope id it's a good solution to allow event consumers to retrieve the entity that originated the event.
The filed name can be something like entityScopeId.

see description

issues.title: Telemetry message published through Streams Api has a wrong clientId stored
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
Telemetry message published through Streams Api has a wrong clientId stored.
The clientId stored is coming from the internal Mqtt connection pool.  

**To Reproduce**
Publish message using Streams Api

**Expected behavior**
curl http://127.0.0.1:9200/index/message/_search?pretty should return:
~~~~
...
"sent_on" : "2018-06-08T15:16:15.515Z",
"body" : null,
"captured_on" : "2018-06-08T15:16:15.515Z",
"client_id" : "client-id-set",
"timestamp" : "2018-06-08T15:16:15.515Z"
...
~~~~
instead of
~~~~
...
"sent_on" : "2018-06-08T15:16:15.515Z",
"body" : null,
"captured_on" : "2018-06-08T15:16:15.515Z",
"client_id" : "mqtt-client-pool-....",

issues.title: Wrong Error Messages When user Does Not Have Proper Permissions
issues.body:
This was originally planned to be part of solution for issue #1796 and PR that will fix it, but for fixing and testing reasons has been split to a new issue.
For now, Kapua's error messages when permissions are not sufficient is for example: "Device edit failed: User does not have permissions to perfrom this action. Missing permissions: device:write:xxxx:xxxxx".
The issue here is the first part, "Device edit failed", which is unnecessary, as user can persume that edit has failed, due to the error shown. 
Bellow there is list of scenarios where this happens. 

1. If user has no more Device:Delete permissions and tries to delete a device (Screenshot No. 1)
2. If user no longer has Device:Write permissions and tries to edit a device (Screenshot No. 2)
3. if user no longer has Device_management:Execute permission and tries to execute a command or start/stop a bundle (Screenshot No. 3)
4. If user no longer has Device_management:Write permission and tries to upload a Snapshot (Screenshot No. 4)
5. If user no longer has Device_Management:Write permission and tries to change device's configuration; For now, Kapua reacts as new changes are saved/discarded (flash, loading screen, refresh), but changes are not actually saved. It should be done as in Assets: if user does not have permissions any more and clicks anything, everything disables. (Screenshot No. 5)
6. If user no longer has Job:Delete permission and tries to delete a job Step (Screenshot No. 6)
7. If user no longer has Job:Delete permission and tries to delete a job (Screenshot No. 7)
8. If user no longer has Job:Execute permission and tries to start or restart a job (Screenshot No. 8)
9. If user no longer has Job:Delete permissions and tries to delete a Target (Screenshot No. 9)
10. If user no longer has Schedule:Delete permission and tries to delete a Schedule (Screenshot No. 10)
11. if user no longer has Tag:Delete permission and wants to delete a tag. Also here are two identical errors - this should be fixed also (Screenshot No. 11)
12. If user no longer has Credential:Delete permission and wants to delete a credential (Screenshot No. 12)
13. If user no longer has Credential:Write permission and wants to edit a credential (Screenshot No. 13)
14. If user no longer has Credential:Write permission and wants to unlock a credential (Screenshot No. 4)
15. If user no longer has Access_info:delete permission and wants to delete a role in users (Screenshot No. 15)
16. If user no longer has Access_info:write permission and wants to add a role to users (Screenshot No. 16)
17. If user no longer has Access_info:delete permission and wants to delete a permission in Users (Screenshot No. 17)
18. If user no longer has Access_info:write permission and wants to add a permission - here Kapua  returns wrong error ("Role assigning failed"), although we are assigning a permission in Users (Screenshot No. 18)

issues.title: "Ends On" And "Starts On" Date Fields In Error State Although All Parameters Are Valid
issues.body:
If user first enters invalid parameters for Start Date and End Date (End is before Start) and also enters valid Retry Interval and CRON schedule, presses Submit and then changes Start/End Dates so Start is before End (or End is after Start - yes, these are two different scenarios with two different outcomes), End/Start date remains in Error state. 

**Testflow for "Ends On":**
1. Login as kapua-sys or any other user that has proper permissions
2. Go to Jobs, create a job (e.g. job0) 
3. Select job0 and go to its Schedules tab
4. Click Add and enter a valid Schedule Name
5. Set Start Date to 9.1.2019 and End date to 2.1.2019
6. Set Start Time to 00:00 and End time to 01:00
7. Set Retry interval to "1" and CRON schedule to "0 0 12 * * ?"
8. Press Submit
**At this point Kapua will set Start date, End Date, Retry interval and Cron to error states, which is OK.**
9. Set Start Date to 1.1.2019 and observe how End Date is still in error state (Screenshot No. 1)

**Testflow for "Starts On":**
1. Login as kapua-sys or any other user that has proper permissions
2. Go to Jobs, create a job (e.g. job0) 
3. Select job0 and go to its Schedules tab
4. Click Add and enter a valid Schedule Name
5. Set Start Date to 9.1.2019 and End date to 2.1.2019
6. Set Start Time to 00:00 and End time to 01:00
7. Set Retry interval to "1" and CRON schedule to "0 0 12 * * ?"
8. Press Submit
**At this point Kapua will set Start date, End Date, Retry interval and Cron to error states, which is OK.**
9. Set End Date to 10.1.2019 and observe how Start Date is still in error state (Screenshot No. 2)

**Expected behavior**

issues.title: Service event loader overrides the service event address with the module configured address
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
The current service event implementation allows to set a different address to each service ([ServiceEventClientConfiguration](https://github.com/eclipse/kapua/blob/develop/commons/src/main/java/org/eclipse/kapua/commons/event/ServiceEventClientConfiguration.java)), but the service event loader ([ServiceEventModule](https://github.com/eclipse/kapua/blob/develop/commons/src/main/java/org/eclipse/kapua/commons/event/ServiceEventModule.java)) uses the module address ([ServiceEventModuleConfiguration](https://github.com/eclipse/kapua/blob/develop/commons/src/main/java/org/eclipse/kapua/commons/event/ServiceEventModuleConfiguration.java#L18)) to bind the listening/raising service to the correct address.
This bug doesn't allow to specify a different listening/raising address for the services contained in the same module.

**To Reproduce**
Just try to configure a service with a different address than that contained in the module configuration.

issues.title: Multiple Same Endpoints Can Be Implicitly Created
issues.body:
There is a way to create multiple same endpoints. If you first login with kapua-sys and create "kapua.com/kapua.com/123/false" endpoint and then create a child account and within that account same endpoint (see the detailed testflow bellow), kapua does not report any errors, although this same endpoint already exists. If user now switches to kapua-sys (top parnet account), there are two identical endpoints if the original one (from kapua-sys) is deleted.

This can be done for all child accounts, so for example, if you have 20 child accoutns, and every account has "kapua.com/kapua.com/123/false" endpoint, then you see 20 identical endpoints in kapua-sys account.

**Testflow:**
1. Login as kapua-sys 
2. Go to Endpoints, create a sample endpoint (e.g. kapua.com/kapua.com/123/false)
3. Go to Child Accounts, create a child account (e.g. child0)
4. Switch to child account, go to Endpoints, create endpoint "google.com/google.com/123/false"
5. Now add another endpoint "kapua.com/kapua.com/123/false" and delete the "google.com" endpoint
6. Repeat steps 3-5 two more times (create child1 and child2) 
7. Go back to kapua-sys and delete the only endpoint. 
**Observe how all the endpoints from all the child accounts are gathered - they are all the same.**

**Expected behavior**
I guess this should not be allowed - Kapua should be cross-checking if the endpoints with these parameters already exists?

issues.title: Avoid sending the disconnect message in case of stealing link and refactor the internal connect/disconnect message
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
The device disconnect message is sent even if the disconnection is due to a stealing link or if the broker is not the owner of the current device connection.
So we want to avoid to send this message when it's due to a stealing link or the broker isn't the owner of the device connection.
Refactor the connect/disconnect internal message to make its processing easier.


**To Reproduce**
Subscribe to the MQTT/DISCONNECT semantic topic and trigger a stealing link. A disconnect message will be received.

**Expected behavior**
no disconnect message is sent in case of stealing link

issues.title: Service events - uncorrect ServiceEvent stack handling on nested calls
issues.body:
The ServiceEvent bean stack is not correctly managed by the ServiceEventScope. The end method cleans the stack regardless if there is more than one object in the stack.
So if a main event raises a child event, the end call of the child event will clean the ServiceEvent stack leading the end call of the main event to throw a KapuaRuntimeException.

To fix it the end call should check for the stack size before cleaning it from the ThreadContext.

issues.title: Fix JMSServiceEventBus lifecycle
issues.body:
Fix JMSServiceEventBus lifecycle

After a JMSServiceEventBus stop call it's not possible to call a start whithout getting a NPE.
To avoid that, the inner class instance used by the JMSServiceEventBus should be instantiated inside the start call.

issues.title: CSV injection on Console
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
It is possible to insert malicious values in the device data which, once exported in CSV and into Excel/Pages desktop application, will be interpreted as formulas.

****Malicious data example****
 
A device that has a Display name starting with either `=`, `+`, `-`, `@`

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Connect a device with a display name "=A1".
2. Export the device table to CSV
3. Import the data into MS Excel or Apple Pages.

The value is interpreted as a formula, without no promt from the Excel/Pages program

**Expected behavior**
This values should be excaped

issues.title: Fix vulnerabilities in ServiceDAO
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
ServiceDAO has few vulnerabilities on two methods:

- `find(...)`
- `delete(...)`

They allow to find and delete any entity if you are logged in and if you have the entityId.

**To Reproduce**
1. Login with REST API into account A
2. Fetch a User of that scope and keep the User ID
3. Login on another account B that has no permission on account A
4. Make a REST GET on `/user/{userId}` with the scopeId of account B and the userID of the user from the account A

User is returned.

**Expected behavior**
Cross tenant should be avoided.

**Describe the bug**
Using `XmlUtil.unmarshalJson()` to unmarshal a JSON string representing a `KapuaListResult` throws an exception:

```
javax.xml.bind.UnmarshalException: Line -1, Col: -1.
    Error message: 
Exception Description: Cannot add the object [org.eclipse.kapua.service.user.internal.UserImpl@486b35d5], of class [class org.eclipse.kapua.service.user.internal.UserImpl], to container [class java.util.Collections$UnmodifiableRandomAccessList].
Internal Exception: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
    Linked exception message:
Exception Description: Cannot add the object [org.eclipse.kapua.service.user.internal.UserImpl@486b35d5], of class [class org.eclipse.kapua.service.user.internal.UserImpl], to container [class java.util.Collections$UnmodifiableRandomAccessList].
Internal Exception: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
- with linked exception:
[Exception [EclipseLink-6065] (Eclipse Persistence Services - 2.6.3.v20160428-59c81c5): org.eclipse.persistence.exceptions.QueryException
Exception Description: Cannot add the object [org.eclipse.kapua.service.user.internal.UserImpl@486b35d5], of class [class org.eclipse.kapua.service.user.internal.UserImpl], to container [class java.util.Collections$UnmodifiableRandomAccessList].
Internal Exception: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException]
```

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Using REST API, get a JSON representing a `KapuaListResult` object (e.g. GET /users)
2. Try to unmarshal such JSON via `XmlUtil.unmarshalJson()`

**Expected behavior**
The JSON is correctly unmarshalled to the desired object

1.0.0-M7

**Type of deployment**
[x] Local Vagrant deployment

[x] Openshift (in its variants)

_Note: since this is strictly a code issue, it always appears regardless of the deployment_

**Main component affected**
Test
REST API

The exception is thrown because the `getItems()` method of KapuaListResult returns an unmodifiable collection; however this unmodifiable list makes little sense, since you can add and remove items from them using various methods on KapuaListResult.

issues.title: Kapua Reporting Locked User Because Of Password Expired Date
issues.body: If we create a user with expired password, Kapua reports (when we are trying to login as this use) that "User has been locked. Contact your account administrator..." although PASSWORD credential is not really locked and therefore user is not actually locked. I propose three solutions: 1) If user sets Expiration Date for a Credential in the past, _Status_ (the "key" icon) or the _Lock Status_ should turn red. After the user would unlock the credential, Expiration Date would be deleted (set to null, N/A). 2) Second option is to change the error message from "User has been locked..." to "User's PASSWORD hass expired. Contact your account administrator." This introduces some security "risks" as potential attacker then knows that password has expired and user has not been actually locekd. 3) Changing the Kapua message to "User has been locked or password has expired. Contact you account administrator." or something similar. Maybe other ideas/suggestions? **Testflow:** 1) Login as kapua-sys 2) Go to Users, create a user (e.g. kapua-user0) 3) Set Expiration date for kapua-user0 password for a time and date in past 4) Logout as kapua-sys and try to login as kapua-user0 **Observe the error message from Kapua.** **Expected behavior** If user sets an Expiration Date for Password (or API_KEY) in the past, the lock symbol should turn red or error message should be changed when trying to login with user whos password has expired. **Screenshot No. 1 (Setting an expired password for a user):** ![screen shot 2018-07-03 at 09 23 26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15121999/42206295-008242da-7ea7-11e8-8a5a-6edfee297728.png) **Screenshot No. 2 ("User locked" error message, although only user's password is expired):** **Version of Kapua** 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT **Type of deployment** [ ] Local Vagrant deployment [x] Docker [ ] Openshift (in its variants) [ ] Others **Main component affected** [x] Console [ ] REST API [ ] Message Broker [ ] - Others Browsers used: - Google Chrome (Version 67.0.3396.99 (Official Build) (64-bit)) - Safari (Version 11.1 (13604.3.5)) - Mozilla Firefox (61.0 (64-bit)) - Opera (Version 54.0.2952.41)

issues.title: Console - Data view metric filtering not working properly
issues.body:
Looking at the code of the GwtDataServiceImpl it seems that the filtering by headers is not properly working.

It shows the only selected metric, but It does not add the datastore predicate (it should use the `metricPredicate`)  to the query.

[GwtDataServiceImpl:450](https://github.com/eclipse/kapua/blob/54f5bd4f9e7348372341de219d8d2ab53b67637f/console/module/data/src/main/java/org/eclipse/kapua/app/console/module/data/server/GwtDataServiceImpl.java#L450): header are passed and never added to the query

[GwtDataServiceImpl:469](https://github.com/eclipse/kapua/blob/54f5bd4f9e7348372341de219d8d2ab53b67637f/console/module/data/src/main/java/org/eclipse/kapua/app/console/module/data/server/GwtDataServiceImpl.java#L469):  header are passed and never added to the query again.

[KapuaGwtDataModelConverter:73](https://github.com/eclipse/kapua/blob/54f5bd4f9e7348372341de219d8d2ab53b67637f/console/module/data/src/main/java/org/eclipse/kapua/app/console/module/data/shared/util/KapuaGwtDataModelConverter.java#L73): header are used to extract specific metric from the message payload, but it could be that one of the extracted messages hasn't the requested metric.

The result is that you'll end up with empty cell in the result table, while the correct behaviour should be that the messages should be skipped from the results.

issues.title: Filtering Through Kapa Not "Unified"
issues.body:
For now, filtering is not "unified". For example, some of the fields require that searched string is exaclty the same as "target" string (e.g. Custom Attributes fields in Device filter), others require that a character entered is anywhere in the "target" string (e.g. Job name). Is this OK, or not? What is the proper filter operation? 

**_Connections:_**
**- Connection CLiend ID:** Finds match if character or string entered appears anywhere in Cliend ID
**- Conncetion Client IP:** Finds match if character or string entered appears anywhere in Connection Client IP

**_Devices:_** 
**- Device Client ID:** Finds a match if string of characters matches beginning of the target string (if a device's ID is "device123", Kapua will not find it, if users enters "evi" or "123", but will find if entered "d", "dev" or "devic")
**- Device Display Name:** Finds a match if string of characters matches beginning of the target string (if a device's Display Name is "device123", Kapua will not find it, if users enters "evi" or "123", but will find if entered "d", "dev" or "devic")
**- Serial Number:** / non-testable
**- IoT Framework Version:** String has to be complete match (e.g. KURA_3.1.1, not even "K" or "KURA" will suffice, user has to enter "KURA_3.1.1" into search field)
**- Applications:** Finds match if character or string entered appears anywhere in Applications field
**- Custom Attribute No. 1:** String has to be a complete match (e.g. if attribute is "device123", user has to enter "device123", "dev", "123", device12" will not work)
**- Custon Attribute No. 2:** String has to be a complete match (e.g. if attribute is "device123", user has to enter "device123", "dev", "123", device12" will not work)

**_Jobs:_**
**- Job Name:** Finds match if character or string entered appears in any job name

**_Tags:_**
**- Tag Name:** Finds match if character or string entered appears in any tag name

**_Users:_**
**- Username field:** Finds match if character or string entered appears in any username

**_Roles:_**
**- Role Name:** Finds match if character or string entered appears in any role name

**_Access Groups:_**
**- Access Group Name:** Finds match if character or string entered appears in any group name

**_Child Accounts:_**
**- Account Name:** Finds match if character or string entered appears in any account name
**- Account Organization Name:** Finds match if character or string entered appears in any organization name
**- Account Email:** Finds match if character or string entered appears any email name

Browsers used: 
- Google Chrome (Version 65.0.3325.181 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Safari (Version 11.1 (13604.3.5))
- Mozilla Firefox (59.0.2  (64-bit))
- Opera (Version 52.0.2871.64)

I propose that a pop-up window shows after a period of inactivity (when user tries to continue working) saying that user is not logged in any more boceuase of inactivity or "longer" period of time during which user can properly read the info message.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Long (integer) value validation in NumberField (#1723)

While validating Long that is 64 bit values for integers there is wrong
validation of max value. Value is not validated correctly because
value is converted to Double before validating. This problem occurs because
Double can have mantisa which is 2^52 (signed). This brings validation to
that value.
To solve issue, max value is not set to Long.MAX_VALUE but to
4.503.599.627.370.496. If this is not good enough, NumberField provided
by GXT can not be used, as its validator uses Double for storing its values.

Other types should function correctly, as there is no limitation with conversion
to Double.

This solves issue #1634

Signed-off-by: Uros Mesaric Kunst <uros.mesaric-kunst@comtrade.com>

issues.title: Kapua Reports Error in Access Group Field When Editing Device
issues.body:
If user has several devices (e.g. 30) and starts to edit their parameters one by one, Kapua at some devices eventually (after 20+ consecutive edits) starts to show error by Acccess Group field - as there would be an empty field or some other error. 
This is not right, because when user creates (or connects) a device, it is automatically  added to a group, so when editing a device there shoud be no errors. 

Testflow: 
1. Login as kapua-sys
2. Go to Child Accounts, create a child account (e.g. kapua-sys-master)
3. Set all the kapua-sys-master account settings to Infinite (Users, Tags, Groups, Devices...)
4. Within kapua-sys-master create a user (e.g. kapua-sys-master) and give it ALL:ALL:ALL permissions (with Forwardable set to True)
5. Login as kapua-sys-master user and go to Devices
6. Add several devices (more than 20, e.g. device0, device1,...) and add them all to "No group" group. 
7. Go to Groups, create a group (e.g. group0)
8. Go back to devices, start changing the device Access Groups from "No group" to group0, one by one. 
**At some point, when editing a device, Kapua will report an error (red exclmation mark on the right side) saying, that there are errors in this field, although there aren't any.**

issues.title: KapuaRuntimeException and KapuaException cannot handle null arguments
issues.body:
Hi all, 

in some device management services we lost the managing of the `KuraResponseCode` when parsing the response from the device. 

If the response is `200` everything is fine, while on error not parsing this response code causes `NullPointerException` in the subsequent code.

Affected device management are:

DeviceAssetManagementService
DeviceBundleManagementService
DeviceConfigManagementService
DevicePackageManagementService
DeviceSnapshotManagementService

Regards, 

_Alberto_

issues.title: Device management - Missing existence checks
issues.body:
Hi all, 

we are currently missing a check on the Device existence while doing device management operations.
When performing a device management operation we should check that the Device exists, otherwise in the processing we will end up in a `NullPointerException` since some methods extract data from the `Device`.

Regards,

Alberto

issues.title: Device Management - Missing `ConnectionStatus` check
issues.body:
Hi all, 

we are currently missing a check on the `DeviceConnection.getStatus()` attribute.
When performing a device management operation we should check that the `Device` has a `DeviceConnection` and that this `DeviceConnection` has a `status` which is `CONNECTED`. 

Without this check any operation performed by `Job`s or REST API device management will end up in a operation executed which will always timeout.

Regards, 

_Alberto_

>   while locating org.eclipse.kapua.service.user.internal.UserServiceModule
>   while locating org.eclipse.kapua.commons.core.ServiceModule annotated with @com.

The error is due  to the fact that the list of service modules are retrieved (and instantiated) before completing the initialization of the locator (for the Guice implementation). The retrieve of the service modules triggers the initialization of some service implementations which in turn try to access the locator.

#### Expected behavior
Objects managed by the Kapua locator do not have to be created before the locator itself is completely initialized (for the Guice implementation). The solution is to defer the instantiation of any object until the locator is fully initialized.

issues.title: Lockout policy conflicts with Swagger UI
issues.body:
Hi,

It is a very annoying and rare problem I have experienced, but I could not repeat until now. When I am using the Swagger UI and the Kapua WebConsole simultaneously, after switching from one to another I lose my authentication credentials, so I have to log in again. The problem is, that if I change the System Admin (kapua-sys) password, he could get locked out. It does not depend on whether the Lockout Service is enabled or not, or if it is how it is configured. The system admin gets locked out with the preset Lockout Service settings.

Note: The lockout happens instantly, you don't even have to type a wrong password...

Here is the test sequence:

1. Install Kapua and log in with _kapua-sys_
2. Create a child account ("c_account")
3. Enable infinite child users
4. **Disable Lockout service**
5. Create a new user of c_account (c_user, pass: new_password)
6. Grant him ALL permissions
7. **Change system admin password** (clicking change password in the top right corner)
[new pass: new_password]
8. Go to Swagger UI
9. Request authentication/user and log in with c_user/new_password (not with sys-admin)
10. Go back to web console (you will be dropped out after a few seconds)
11. Try to log in with kapua-sys/new_password
12. It will say that the account is locked contact System Administrator...

NOTE: I also observed some things which can be helpful
- As in my example the child account's user password and the system admin changed password was the same. (but I don't think that matters)
- The system admin has been locked out, however I still could use the child account's user
- The system admin was useless both in the web console and the Swagger UI
- The system admin lockout was resolved after a day passed from last login attempt (but I think that was just the default 10800 seconds of the Lockout Service)
- It **only** occured **when I changed the** system admin **password**
- Because of the long resolution time I couldn't run more experiment on this matter
- I cannot change the Kapua settings until I create a child account (the settings are grey)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26169252/37404990-ba40bf5a-2793-11e8-91cd-e92f455527eb.png)
- After I have a child account I switch to that account, go to settings, change back to kapua-sys, refresh, and THEN I can change the settings.

It was extremely frustrating the first time and now that I can recreate it and have fears using the web console and the Swagger UI simultaneously because of that. Thank you for your help.

issues.title: Device management operations hide errors
issues.body:
During a device management operation if the communication does not incur in TimeoutException or other communication-related errors but the device returns an error code while processing the message, no error code or error alert is returned to the caller of the device management operation.

So if you perform any operation in which the device does not respond 200 as responseCode the only way to see the device management operation result is to look at the DeviceEvent created.

It would be more appropriate that, if an error occurs, an appropriate exception si thrown to notify the caller.

issues.title: JWT certificate now always selected correctly from the DB
issues.body:
When you have multiple `Certificate`s used for JWT signing (so having `CertificateUsage` set to `JWT`) it happens that not always the correct certificate is chosen for the generation or the validation afterwards. 
This causes problems in using REST API because you are forced to delete all other `Certificate`s but the one that is actually active.

issues.title: No Error If Start Time in Job Schedule Entered in Wrong Format
issues.body: The proper format for entering schedule's time into for a certain job is HH:MM (hours:minutes), but user can add this parameter also in format H:MM and in if this is the case for _**start time**_, user gets no error at all (look at the screenshot). Kapua should return erorr message that format is wrong. Testflow: 1. Login as kapua-sys 2. Go to Jobs, create new job (e.g. job1) 3. Add schedule to job1 (as Time parameter try to enter 7:00 as start time) **Kapua returns no errors as shown bellow (if user clicks _Submit_ nothing happens.** Screenshot: Browsers used: - Google Chrome (Version 63.0.3202.84 (Official Build) (64-bit)) - Safari (Version 11.0.2 (13604.3.5)) - Mozilla Firefox (57.0.1 (64-bit)) - Opera (Version 49.0.2725.64)

issues.title: Wrong Error If End Time in Job Schedule Entered in Wrong Format
issues.body:
The proper format for entering schedule's time into for a certain job is HH:MM (hours:minutes), but user can add this parameter also in format H:MM and in this case Kapua returns an error _**No end time specified with end date**_ which is wrong. This also happens if time parameter is entered as HH:MMMMM. 
Kapua should return erorr message that format is wrong and not that time is not specified at all. 

Testflow: 
1. Login as kapua-sys
2. Go to Jobs, create new job (e.g. job1) 
3. Add schedule to job1 (as Time parameter try to enter 7:00 or 8:15 - without the first zero)
**Kapua returns an error as described above.**

Screenshot: 
![screenshotno3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15121999/34564418-f0fd4374-f156-11e7-8599-04aa67ba7e61.png)

Browsers used:
- Google Chrome (Version 63.0.3202.84 (Official Build) (64-bit))
- Safari (Version 11.0.2 (13604.3.5))
- Mozilla Firefox (57.0.1 (64-bit))
- Opera (Version 49.0.2725.64)

issues.title: Kapua Does Not Report Error If Years in Users Entered in Wrong Format
issues.body: When entering expiration date for Credentials and Permissions in Users, years should be added as four digit number (YYYY) but Kapua accepts all dates from 0 - 199999. Testflow: 1. Login as kapua-sys 2. Go to Users, add or edit existing user (e.g. kapua-user1) 3. Select kapua-user1, go to Credentials and/or Permissions and set Expiration date with the year parameter > 9999. **If Expiration date is in range 0 - 199999, Kapua accepts it, although format is _YYYY_.** Screenshot (Entering Expriation date in wrong format): Browsers used: - Google Chrome (Version 63.0.3202.84 (Official Build) (64-bit)) - Safari (Version 11.0.2 (13604.3.5)) - Mozilla Firefox (57.0.1 (64-bit)) - Opera (Version 49.0.2725.64)

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fixing issue with leaving dirty input forms (#1493)

Fixing issue with leaving dirty input forms

There are forms on UI that can be left in dirty state by using main
menu - West menu.
This was solved by adding dirty form flag on gwtSession object and
when user uses West menu it is notified that changes will be lost and
can decide if this is ok or not.

Changes were required to WestNavigationView and that could break unexpected
functionality of UI. It was tested but not overall UI tested.

Problem was that TextField and TextArea are not listening on some of
onBlur events, and this was causing form not to marked as being changed.

I extended KapuaTextField and added KapuaTextArea that are now reacting
on this onBlur events. I used those two in DeviceConfigPanel.

Password field in Configuration panel is also converted to KapuaTextField.

This fixes issue #1137.

Signed-off-by: Uros Mesaric Kunst <uros.mesaric-kunst@comtrade.com>

issues.title: Groups should not be assignable for non groupable permissions
issues.body:
When granting permissions to a user or a role, it is always allowed to assign a group while, for some domain it doesn't make sense. For example the domain "broker" is not groupable hence the group field should not be assignable. Here is a first list of (currently) non groupable domains:
* Domain
* Account
* User
* Group
* Tag
* Role
* Access Info
* Access Token
* Credential
* Broker
* Device connection
* Device events
* Device lifecycle
* Device managements
* Job

Kapua returns an error: **Error loading device: null** Browsers used: - Google Chrome (Version 62.0.3202.94 (Official Build) (64-bit)) - Safari (Version 11.0.1 (13604.3.5)) - Mozilla Firefox (57.0 (64-bit)) - Opera (Version 49.0.2725.34)

issues.title: No Error Message If maxNumberChildJobs exceeded
issues.body: Best way to describe this issue is through an example. Create a child account from kapua-sys (e.g. kapua-child1), set InfiniteChildJobs to false and maxNumberChildJobs to 2. After that switch to kapua-child1, create new child account (e.g. kapua-child2) and add two jobs to kapua-child1. When user tries to change InfiniteChildJobs to True or change maxNumberChildJobs to something greater than 0 in kapua-child2 account, error without message pops-up (look at the screenshot). Empty error message also appears if we (after 2 jobs have been added in kapua-child1) switch to kapua-sys and try to lower maxNumberChildJobs of kapua-child1 from 2 to 1 or 0. Testflow: 1. Login as kapua-sys 2. Go to Child Accounts, create new child account (e.g. kapua-child1) 3. Set InfiniteChildUsers to False and maxNumberChildAccounts to 1 4. Go to JobService, set infiniteChildJobs to False and maxNumberChildJobs to 2 5. Switch to kapua-child1 account and create two jobs 6. Create one child account (e.g. kapua-child2) 7. In kapua-child2 try to set infiniteChildJobs to True or maxNumberChildJobs to >0 **Kapua returns an error message without content, but there should really be an explanation that maximum number of jobs has been exceeded.** Browsers used: - Google Chrome (Version 62.0.3202.94 (Official Build) (64-bit)) - Safari (Version 11.0.1 (13604.3.5)) - Mozilla Firefox (57.0 (64-bit)) - Opera (Version 49.0.2725.34)

issues.title: The Permission tab should be hidden for a user with no permissions on accessInfo service
issues.body:
A user with permission to connect to the console (es account:view and user:view) but with no permissions on the accessInfo service can view the permissions tab in the user view even though he cannot do any action on it.

Testflow:

* Connect to kapua-sys as kapua-sys
* Create a new user kapua-user with the following permisssions
  * account:read:all:all
  * user:read:all:all
* Logout and login as kapua-user
* Open the user view
* Click on the Permission tab
* The an error pop-up appears explaining that the user does't have enough permisssions (which is correct)

Expected:

* The permission tab is disabled and hidden.

issues.title: LockoutPolicy.lockDuration And LockoutPolicy.resetAfter Do Not Work
issues.body:
When setting LockoutPolicy.lockDuration and LockoutPolicy.resetAfter to some random number there is no change in lock behaviour.

Testflow:
1) log into kapua-sys
2) create new child account (e.g. kapua-child1) and add new user (e.g. kapua-user1)
3) Set parameters to:
- LockoutPolicy.resetAfter: 10 (seconds) 
- LockoutPolicy.lockDuration: 60 (seconds)
4) give kapua-user1 ALL permissions
5) log out as kapua-sys and try to log into kapua-user1 (entering wrong password)
Both values of these settings get somehow ignored (just like at LockoutPolicy.maxFailures). 
Error reported: 
**Login Failed.
Your user has been locked. Contact your account administrator to unlock.**

When setting infiniteChildRoles to false and adding desired number of ChildRoles, I get an error  when trying to add new Roles in the child account.

2) Switch account to newly created account (kapua-child1), go to Roles and try do add new role with unique name. At this point Kapua returns following Error: 
**Error: An illegal value was provided for the argument scopeId: max roles reached.**

After I try to change **infiniteChildRoles** to **true**, I can only enter values **100** or **300.** Also if I enter **300**, I cannot change it back to **100.**

issues.title: Custom Date Range Problem
issues.body:
When trying to set custom date range for presenting data I found some errors: 

**1)** It is possible to enter negative year.
**2)** Dates till 31.12.1936 are automatically added 100 years (e.g. 1.1.1900 = 1.1.2000, 12.10.1936 = 12.10.2036...).
**3)** Dates from 10.10.2037 are mapped 100 years earlier (e.g. 1.10.2037 = 1.10.1937, 12.11.2042 = 12.11.1942...).
**4)** All dates from 0 - 18xx are mapped to 19xx (e.g. 1810 = 1910, 1712 = 1912...).

issues.title: Find another way to represent allowSelfEdit for service configuration
issues.body: Currently services configuration uses the OSGi Metatype  `<Option>` to specify whether an account can modify a specified attribute or not. However such tag should be used to specify allowed options for a given attribute, more and less like the HTML `<option>` inside a `<select>`. We should find another way to specify `allowSelfEdit` and other properties we  could introduce in the future.

issues.title: Random QA tests failures
issues.body:
Hi all,

after merging #583 some random test failures started to appear more frequently. We had already some random failures on qa tests but they were occasional.

After digging a bit I discovered that is a problem related to how Liquibase script are loaded and the fact that the Kapua Liquibase Client  is run from many different places concurrently. 

The KapuaLiquibaseClient was implemented to copy resources from the jar to a tmp directory and then execute it immediately. With the improvement contained on #583  all scripts gets copied and then executed. 

For the fact that KapuaLiquibaseClient is run from different places it can happen that the copied resources gets overwritten by another KapuaLiquibaseClient is executing them, with even more chance that now that apply of Liquibase scripts takes a bit longer.

I'll fix this making execution of Liquibase script `synchronized` as a simple patch.

Regards,

_Alberto_

issues.title: Liquibase script refactoring
issues.body:
Hi all, 

while working on #583 I discovered something odd on Liquibase.
By default it uses absolute path name as a key to know if a file has been executed already or not. 
This means that If the same script is executed from a different directory Liquibase wouldn't be able to recognize that is has already been executed and try to execute it again.

There is a property to override this called `logicalFilePath`, which value is used as a key instead of the absolute path. This property must be added to all file with changeset to execute. 
I was not able to add it to the plan SQL file and I suspect that we have to convert them to XML|YAML|JSON format to be able to specify that property. 

BTW the current layout works fine for tests and demo deployment. It could be a problem in case of more complex usage.

Regards,

_Alberto_


EDIT: 
Documentation page of this property: http://www.liquibase.org/documentation/databasechangelog.html

issues.body:
Hi all,

We have a bug that is also a security problem. 
When we add a new permission we do not check the `targetScopeId` set. 
Is fine when is the same of the `scopeId`  of the permission, but when they are different we need to check that the current user has the permission on the `targetScopeId` of the new permission. 
If not, any user with `role:manage` or `access-info:manage` can add permission in other accounts.

Regards, 

_Alberto_

issues.title: Add permission forward-ability
issues.body:
Hi all,

we need to implement the feature of "forward-ability" of the permissions. 
This means that an account A with a child account B must be able to manage resources of the account B.

The logic would be that a user A of the account A that has per permission A has the same permission on the account B, as if user A has both A and B permission. 

To allow restriction of this behaviour a new flag on the permission will tell if the permission is forward-able or not. 

The current situation is that `kapua-sys` account can manage child account because it has `*:*:*:*` permission. But if a child account A of `kapua-sys` has another child account B, the A account will only be able to delete the account and not to create users/roles/etc on the account B.

Regards, 

_Alberto_

issues.title: Initialization of the JAXBContextProvider in the console does not happen
issues.body:
Currently the initialization of the JAXBContextProvider for the console is done inside the class:

* KapuaHttpServlet

An instance of this class, however, may not be created by the time when the JAXBContextProvider needs to be used. For example:

* Start with a completely new deployment of Kapua
* Start the components (the console, the SqlDB and the datastore)
* Login into the console
* Click on "Settings" in the main menu on the left

A popup message appear due to an error in the marshalling/unmarshalling of the service scoped configurations due to the fact that the JAXBContextProvider has not been initialized yet.

Move the initialization under the class:

* org.eclipse.kapua.app.console.server.util.ConsoleListener

The listener is created before any servlet or filter gets created.

```
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
```

Appears when requesting messages from the REST API. 

After an investigation by me and @lorthirk  we discovered that there is a jackson version clash between Elasticsearch 2.x (which requires jackson-* 2.6.6) and Swagger 1.5.12 (which requires jackson-* 2.8.6).

This error appear only on the REST API because is the only project that uses Elasticsearch and Swagger at the same time, so it is possible to have working only Swagger or only ES.

The solution proposed is to revert the version of Swagger to 1.5.10 which can work with Jackson 2.6.6 until ES 5.x is introduced by @riccardomodanese.

This should make everything work nice and smooth.

Regards, 

_Alberto_

issues.title: Database schema: General issue with IDs
issues.body:
There is a general issue regarding the ID fields in the database.
The table creation scripts define all IDs as BIGINT(21) UNSIGNED (i.e. **scope_id    BIGINT(21)  UNSIGNED NOT NULL**).
Nevertheless it is possible to create an ID from a negative integer (i.e. **new KapuaEid(BigInteger.valueOf(-1))**) and the database will not complain. Searching the database with such ID is also successful.
This is somewhat counter-intuitive, as the field definition seems to imply that IDs with negative values should be rejected by the database.

issues.title: Database schema: act_account table / parent_account_path length issue
issues.body:
There is a possible inconsistency in the **act_account** table, specifically the **parent_account_path** field.
The current create script (**act_account_create.sql**) defines this field as a **VARCHAR(64)**. Given that there is no limit to the depth of sub-account creation this seems to be too short.
Specifically, this length is exceeded even with an account tree 3 levels deep. An example is as follows.
When creating 3 account levels, the resulting parent path is
'\1/-4796103609285693743/-4305601355848753009/-1017280879925618445'
Please note that this string is 65 characters long and as such it causes an JdbcSQLException.
As it looks it seems that this inconsistency was introduced when the old (and shorter) IDs were replaced with the new BigInteger (far longer) IDs.

issues.title: Device event date bug
issues.body:
Hi all, 

while working on issue #47 I discovered that the broker deployend into develop vagrant machine stores device events two hours before the actual time. 

Then by looking at the SQL db table I saw that actually seems that the console stores events in UTC+2 rather than use UTC+0. 

We need to find from where this timezone issue generates.

Regards, 

_Alberto_
